page.title: 11Cameley Mill i
page.content:
Cameley Mill was built over 300 years ago.Water from the River Cam was collected in a pond,then used to drive the mill wheel.In addition to milling corn part of the building may have been used as a dairy and cheese factory.The building is made of Pennant Stone and White Lias.It has many low beams,and small rooms leading of one another.Many of the doorways were extremely low,some only 4 feet high.The first known owners of the mill were the Hippesley family.In 1919 it was sold to John Joseph Abbott who used it as a 150 acre dairy farm,and the mill became a dwelling house.Since 1923 the mill has been owned by 3 generations of the Blacker family.
See also Cameley Mill ii
